from __future__ import division from loncapa import *

A small block with mass m is placed inside an inverted cone that is rotating about a vertical axis such that the time for one revolution of the cone is T as shown in the figure. The walls of the cone make an angle \(\beta\) with the vertical. The coefficient of static friction between the block and the cone is \(\mu_s\). The goal of the problem is to find the magnitude of the force of friction \(F_{fr}\) between the block and the cone's wall if the block is to remain at a constant height h above the apex of the cone.
In your solution clearly indicate:
The system that you consider and the interactions between the object(s) in the system and external objects. Draw the resulting forces in a FBD. Indicate the coordinate system that you will use to describe the vectors. Include in your solutions the model(s) that you use.
What is the magnitude of the force of friction? (Note: the double bars in the expressions below indicate the absolute value).
\(F_{fr}=m\| \frac{v^2}{R}\sin\beta+g\cos\beta \| \)
\(F_{fr}=m\|\frac{v^2}{R}\cos\beta+g\sin\beta \|\)
\(F_{fr}=m\|\frac{v^2}{R}\sin\beta-g\cos\beta \|\)
\(F_{fr}=m\|\frac{v^2}{R}\cos\beta-g\sin\beta \|\)
None of the Above
